pages.raw_output:
<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 186, 171, 201]]<|/det|>
# PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 207, 366, 222]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Multiple Choice (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 186, 905, 242]]<|/det|>
0625/22 February/March 2017 45 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 248, 588, 291]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Multiple Choice Answer Sheet Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 312, 388, 329]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 343, 237, 357]]<|/det|>
Write in soft pencil.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 358, 504, 373]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 373, 892, 402]]<|/det|>
Write your name, Centre number and candidate number on the Answer Sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 400, 384, 415]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 429, 892, 459]]<|/det|>
There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions. For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 459, 890, 475]]<|/det|>
Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the separate Answer Sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 488, 556, 504]]<|/det|>
Read the instructions on the Answer Sheet very carefully.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 518, 764, 533]]<|/det|>
Each correct answer will score one mark. A mark will not be deducted for a wrong answer.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 533, 467, 548]]<|/det|>
Any rough working should be done in this booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 549, 359, 564]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators may be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 564, 630, 579]]<|/det|>
Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 99, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 71, 599, 89]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the height of a stack of identical coins.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[326, 97, 668, 242]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 252, 401, 271]]<|/det|>
What is the thickness of one coin?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 280, 134, 299]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 280, 176, 299]]<|/det|>
0.20 mm

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 280, 300, 299]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[310, 280, 383, 299]]<|/det|>
2.0 mm

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 280, 468, 299]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[473, 280, 551, 299]]<|/det|>
0.24 cm

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[616, 280, 636, 299]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 280, 710, 299]]<|/det|>
2.0 cm

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 325, 97, 345]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 325, 688, 345]]<|/det|>
Four balls with different masses are dropped from the heights shown.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[170, 352, 826, 565]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 578, 369, 597]]<|/det|>
Air resistance may be ignored.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 609, 475, 626]]<|/det|>
Which statement about the balls is correct?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 637, 134, 655]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 637, 450, 655]]<|/det|>
Ball P has the greatest acceleration.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 662, 134, 681]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 662, 599, 681]]<|/det|>
Balls Q and R take the same time to fall to the ground.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 689, 131, 707]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 689, 631, 707]]<|/det|>
The acceleration of ball R is half the acceleration of ball P.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 715, 133, 734]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 715, 475, 734]]<|/det|>
Ball S has the greatest average speed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 89]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 72, 860, 91]]<|/det|> An object is travelling in a straight line. The diagram is the speed-time graph for the object. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 102, 678, 121]]<|/det|> At which labelled point is the object accelerating at a changing rate? <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[298, 129, 695, 320]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 350, 96, 368]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 350, 796, 368]]<|/det|> Which statement about the masses and weights of objects on the Earth is correct? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 378, 134, 396]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 378, 658, 396]]<|/det|> A balance can only be used to compare weights, not masses. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 405, 134, 423]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 405, 606, 423]]<|/det|> Heavy objects always have more mass than light ones. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 432, 134, 450]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 432, 608, 450]]<|/det|> Large objects always have more mass than small ones. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 458, 134, 476]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 458, 423, 476]]<|/det|> Mass is a force but weight is not. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 502, 97, 520]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 502, 920, 535]]<|/det|> An object in a space probe above the Earth weighs \(3.5 \text{N}\). The gravitational field strength at the height of the space probe is \(7.0 \text{N / kg}\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 546, 648, 565]]<|/det|> The gravitational field strength on the Earth's surface is \(10 \text{N / kg}\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 577, 702, 594]]<|/det|> What are the mass and the weight of the object on the Earth's surface? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 606, 400, 734]]<|/det|>
mass/kgweight/N
A0.503.5
B0.505.0
C2.03.5
D2.020

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A skydiver jumps from a stationary helicopter and reaches a steady vertical speed. She then opens her parachute.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 117, 559, 135]]<|/det|>
Which statement about the falling skydiver is correct?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 145, 134, 163]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 144, 593, 163]]<|/det|>
As her parachute opens, her acceleration is upwards.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 171, 133, 190]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 170, 767, 189]]<|/det|>
As she falls at a steady speed with her parachute open, her weight is zero.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 198, 133, 216]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 197, 620, 216]]<|/det|>
When she accelerates, the resultant force on her is zero.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 223, 133, 242]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 222, 613, 241]]<|/det|>
When she falls at a steady speed, air resistance is zero.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 268, 96, 286]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 268, 695, 286]]<|/det|>
A car moves in a circular path as it turns a corner on a horizontal road.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 298, 398, 316]]<|/det|>
The car moves at constant speed.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[272, 324, 720, 510]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 521, 606, 540]]<|/det|>
Which description of the forces acting on the car is correct?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 551, 133, 568]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 551, 702, 568]]<|/det|>
All the forces are balanced as the car is moving at constant speed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 577, 133, 596]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 577, 888, 595]]<|/det|>
The forces are unbalanced and the resultant force acts away from the centre of the circle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 603, 133, 621]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 603, 868, 621]]<|/det|>
The forces are unbalanced and the resultant force acts towards the centre of the circle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 630, 133, 648]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 630, 868, 648]]<|/det|>
The forces are unbalanced and the resultant force is in the direction of travel of the car.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 672, 96, 691]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 672, 541, 691]]<|/det|>
A moving body undergoes a change of momentum.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 702, 455, 720]]<|/det|>
What is a unit for change of momentum?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 730, 133, 749]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 730, 188, 749]]<|/det|>
N m

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 730, 311, 749]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[323, 730, 363, 749]]<|/det|>
N/m

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 730, 467, 749]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[475, 730, 515, 749]]<|/det|>
Ns

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[615, 730, 636, 749]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[648, 730, 690, 749]]<|/det|>
N/s

useful work
done against
gravity by lift		useful power
developed by lift

water molecules being hit by pollen grains

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 107, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>20</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 737, 91]]<|/det|>
In a shallow tank, a water wave moves towards a barrier with a narrow gap.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[361, 98, 628, 255]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 270, 546, 289]]<|/det|>
Which diagram shows the wave beyond the barrier?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[368, 300, 390, 319]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 320, 819, 470]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 400, 133, 419]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 400, 175, 419]]<|/det|> 47 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 400, 298, 419]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[311, 400, 343, 419]]<|/det|> 62 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[448, 400, 470, 419]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[473, 400, 520, 419]]<|/det|> 109 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[615, 400, 636, 419]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 400, 688, 419]]<|/det|> 156 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 446, 107, 465]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 446, 920, 479]]<|/det|> The equation represents an isotope of radium Ra decaying to an isotope of radon Rn with the emission of particle X. <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[416, 491, 584, 512]]<|/det|> \[^{226}_{88}\mathrm{Ra}\rightarrow ^{222}_{86}\mathrm{Rn} + \mathrm{X}\] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 526, 275, 545]]<|/det|> What is particle X?
